qys3y3gBb0AM9pMdcfVnpg.text: I must be the one person who doesn't "get" this place. Maybe I don't like British food? Maybe I don't like loud music, and poor service?   We visited this place to celebrate my girlfriend Sarah's 30th Birthday. We were seated outside because it was SO loud inside, we didn't think we would be able to hear ourselves think. The waitress too a bit too long to greet us, or even take our drink orders. Our food took even longer.   I split the Cottage Pasty with my friend, and my half was chilly in the middle. That aside, pasty is NOT my cup of tea.   I ordered the PB&J pasty for desert thinking maybe that would be more up my ally, but it was an odd mix of flavor, and still not my thing.   I didn't drink,  but I may consider coming back to check out their tap because it seemed impressive, but I will eat BEFORE I come.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. Half eaten pasty

hayvJtczpWQBTnMDY2Rwjg.text: Great food don't waste your time with ordering takeout or if there busy 2nd time I was given an attitude by a tattooed pierced wanna be methhead.  Unfortunately there are no managers or adults in charge shame  this place would be amazing if not for a few visibly unhappy waiters especially if you wander into the bar area !   If the owners cared they would take my advice. Nothing is worse then placing an order with someone that feels life owes them a living.  You have an amazing product need to be represented by employees that care and not the fools you have now !

FWBIWWb71KSmx4FnoVoYcA.text: As far as pasties go, this place is the f*ckin' sh*t.  Sorry, I didn't know I was so passionate about pasties, or really what the hell a pasty was before I Yelped this joint for lunch.  Thank the pasty gods I did too because if my gullet could have handled the gastric barrage I would have eaten half a dozen of these delicious meat/cheese/veggie filled wonderlands.   If you're a regular, I'm jealous of your uninhibited access to CPC.  If you've never been, allow my review to sway you.  Go, enjoy and don't let the blacked out storefront, dive-y atmosphere, or bearded culinary artisans dissuade you, you will thank me.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pasty master sculpting delicious art

75QoQ10Q-ddaWJHUcWA5Lw.text: I never reviewed this place?  Sheesh, what kind of Yelper am I?  When I heard Ween being played over the speaker, I knew that this place was something special--someone's got some character here.  The metal menus also caught my attention.  The Cornish Pasty Company specializes in Britain's answer to the calzone, and they do it in a delicious way.  You can get your dough stuffed a large variety of ways--from traditional shepherd's or cottage pie, to Italian and even Indian. Friendly service.   They have something for every taste, so stop by, order a tall one, and dig into one of their flaky creations.  No need for formality--just come as you are, relax, and get into the vibe of this unique spot.

aaVqVNIMc4mnh5kF_pamcg.text: Oh my GOD the sticky toffee pudding . Their freshly baked bread is some of the best I've had. And the red wine gravy is fantastic. This place has never disappointed.

7ye8bF62rgluMrwE5myetg.text: I really just want to point out my experience to the managers, as I don't feel you deserve a bad review for this. But with two separate doors and a very unique layout you must know it's a confusing restaurant. And there is absolutely nothing wrong with that, however that should be a focus for your employees, realizing that every guest should be greeted and either told where to sit or to seat themselves. I awkwardly walked into BOTH entries and neither time did a single employee say hello or even look my way.   Forgot to mention that prior to arriving I called in to check that there wasn't a cover for the fight (most bars were charging if they had the fight on) and the girl that answered was extremely rude (customer service is SO SIMPLE... it pains me when employees are so bad at basic people skills)! It was hard to convince my boyfriend to even give it a shot after speaking to her.   So after this and the lack of acknowledgment when I walked in I couldn't do it. I left, and very disappointed because I truly wanted to give this place a shot. Maybe I'll attempt another location one day.

4XmOsLr5usPzTEj3aldakQ.text: Never disappointed when we eat here. We always get 2 orders of the tandoori wings so we're not fighting over who had more, lol. The pasties are always cooked perfectly. The pasties are pre made, so no customization.

Pw8ODmWIuDA9bgSosK1pkw.text: Best food, service, beer, atmosphere!! They specialize in these hand held absolutely delicious meat/veggie pies. The crust is light and fluffy-like. You have to try one to experience this heavenly taste. They have a variety of options. There is one for everyone!   Their specialty beers are so good! Different types for all you beer connoisseurs! I personally had he raspberry beer. So yummy!   Unfortunately, the only locations are Arizona and Nevada. I was lucky to visit the one in downtown Phoenix. Awesome location with 3 floors.  I'm from CA, so it looks like we'll have to make a trip to Las Vegas! Or a spontaneous road trip to AZ very soon!

F5BzzUarkvwahuwUHH7ufQ.text: This place was different and delicious. I probably wouldn't have tried it if not for the excellent Yelp reviews. It's in a strip mall and we drove by it a couple of times before we found it. When you go inside it feels like a club and not a restaurant. It's very dark inside and a little intimidating. However, we didn't let this deter us. Good thing because the pasties were soooo good. I would love to try them all. Our server was friendly and helpful. Prices were good. Definitely give this a try!

HOvZWdaITIFfy3WXnM7NsA.text: I love this place. Here, i've shared my birthdays, hangovers, dates, heartbreaks, general celebration and merriment. I've showed up in jeans, sari, PJs, mini-skirt; and its always great fun. Ive tried most things on their menu, but tandoori wings are to die for!   The service is sometimes not the best, if you are in a large group. So be patient and talk to your server. Also, it can get loud, because everyone is trying to talk on top of the music. You might want to sit outside if that bothers you.   Make sure you visit the restrooms. They are great fun!

nlxvvbfZVA2SW3gyj8T9UQ.text: Gourmet comfort food at its finest. I love this place so much. Heavy metal music sometimes lol and a staff that you can tell are happy working there

ICA5ufdTHKSaxQPAKhNTPQ.text: Having lived in the UK for 10 years, on my first visit I was a bit worried that the pasties would not be up to scratch. Sooooo glad to say they are extremely good! I'm partial to the "Oggie" and have it every time b/c it's so delicious! I ask for extra sauce too, love it   You can also buy pasties (as in 'past' not 'paste') to cook at home and they come out really well: just follow the instructions on the package they wrap for you. If you like beer there's a very comprehensive menu to satisfy all tastes. Vegetarians and vegans are also catered to, with special pasties full of veggies and other good things - I haven't tried those so can't judge, but from the standard of the ones I have had, I'd say those must be very good too. Have room for dessert?? okay then, I highly recommend the chocolate bread and butter pudding: yummy yum yum! of course the other desserts are great too, they even have a peanut butter and jelly pasty ....so bon appetit everyone and try not to get too addicted to these delicious concoctions....& if you don't already know why, read about the origins of the pasty while you wait for yours

8N1RDGgp2vN2P56bRkdRFw.text: Awesome place with super unique and very delicious menu. This place is a great spot for groups with non meat eaters because they have lots of vegetarian options.

z8O201Cez_b7jChKt3R1oQ.text: Cornish has some of the best food in the valley! We love their pastys and the scotch eggs are one that will always have me coming back. Tim definitely gave the best service we have had there by far. He was efficient and nice and gave great advice on the food. We will be back.

B8KgnHKFjxHjJdc6ZSVplg.text: Not gonna lie, I had no clue what a "Pasty" was before a friend took me here. Much to my delight, it's just a really good Hot Pocket (no offense, Cornish Pasty)!   This place is pretty cool... it has phenomenal food and a really cool and relaxed vibe. I'm not a beer guy personally, but they seemed to have a pretty good selection to choose from. They also have a ton of different pasty options to pick from and my favorite (up to this point) is probably the Italian. They also have a good selection of salads and soups on the menu too.  I definitely recommend checking this place out of you have never been here or if you're a fan of really good Hot Pockets (again, no offense to Cornish Pasty Co.).

pI4yJHP53NmhNdXlZoqWnA.text: Well, I can say I finally say I've eaten at the highly regarded Cornish Pasty.  On the interesting scale, I'd give it a 5. The dark, pub-meets-art-museum (complete with church pews for seats) look of the inside is kind of neat. The servers, completely stereotypical hipster in appearance, all seem nice enough. The menu and food are very different than anything I've seen before.  We ended up ordering the Meat and Cheese pasty and the Mexican. Both were good, and came with the appropriate sauces.  If I have one complaint, it's that pasties are pre-made. So if you don't like a certain ingredient or are allergic to something, there's no ordering the pasty of choice without it; you'll just have to find something without it in it. It also makes me wonder how long some of the less popular pasties have to sit and wait to be ordered.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. A different type of pasties.

43pGlUXAU3ApRmjGRGRCsQ.text: I saw this place while on travel. My grandmother used to make these and so i was hoping they tasted like what she made. I wasnt disappointed with the traditional pasty!  And the red wine gravy is awesome.

BePNLpXkKJho57wlcZJRdg.text: Was in town with a friend and googled  some late night spots and up came cornish pasty.  I was really looking for something chill, had character, good beer selection and something a little different then what im used to from back home. I definately wasnt disappointed. I ordered the cajun chicken and booooy was it bomb. Its a great size and fills you up without making you over the top full. There are so many pasty selections it was almost hard to chose.  Music was on point and so was the service. Only complaint is that you would expect your pasty to come out much quicker than it had, thinking they just bake it for you but Im just being picky.  Would 100% recommend checking out this hole in the wall spot, not to mention im pretty sure I had an arabian goddess as a server who made the experience that much more fun. Great staff. Its a very hipster spot which only made me feel more at home. Check out Cornish pasty! You wont be dissappointed.

n47RbpMuBre2SENRNEACrg.text: Get the Meat and Cheese or the Shepherds Pie pasty. We also get the tomato soup with extra bread and butter for the table.  Guinness is on top.  Order a snake bite which is Guinness and Cider TALL BOY.

u8ThGQ4g7cZwiaVYB_pYpA.text: We were thrilled to find this restaurant!  Lively pub atmosphere with friendly staff and service.  Our family of 4 came here for dinner and all of us enjoyed it!    There were so many different choices of pasty's to choose from that we had a difficult time deciding which ones to order.  Finally decided on the Traditional (steak, potato, onions); Rosemary Chicken pasty; Chicken Pot Pie Pasty and Scotch Egg Cobb Salad.   We definitely want to come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. Rosemary Chicken.
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. Scotch Egg Cobb Salad.
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. Menu

DuqOvTHEqCsGodYJdJdUXQ.text: I remember when they first opened Cornish Pasty over a dozen years ago. It was an immediate hit. Thankfully nothing has changed. Everything is as good and tasty as my first visit.  A group from my office was looking for better food options, rather than the usual burgers, subs or tacos; and we decided to come here.   I hold Cornish Pasty in a special place in my heart, if only for their Bangers & Mash pasty and Scottish Eggs. These are two items that take me back to my trips to the UK and Ireland. For a while, they even had Fuller's London Pride, a great bitter.   Today, we kept it light and ordered Scottish Eggs, Garlic Fries, Meatballs wrapped in Bacon and two different kinds of Pasties. I've included photos, as usual of our tasty lunch. All were delicious and within $10 or so each.   Expect to spend in the $15 - $25 range depending on ...       okay, wait for it...              ... how hungry and thirsty you are.   If you cannot make fun of yourself, who can you make fun of?  LOL.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. Hmmmm, Garlic Fries
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. Interior photo
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. More Bacon  wrapped Meatballs.

8NAguMv-O5mtDrhRekA4OQ.text: This place definitely fits the English/UK pub vibe with lots of wood accents and dark lighting. Many options for Cornish pasty's that it was difficult to decide but the waitress was friendly and helped lead me to the Cubano. The dough was a good consistency being thick but flaky and the flavors were all very good. The choice of the mustard cream sauce with it tick it up a notch. Also got some garlic fries that seemed a tad undercooked and not as crunchy as you would hope, but garlic flavor was good. Their ranch that was given to the table per request you could tell was homemade and was tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cubano

DS0E8SZjkzca8Ealrmzkuw.text: Always great food and a large selection for all tastes. This place has a good wine and beer list and service is always top notch.  Parking can be tight sometimes, depending on the time of day.

duL090SFOvVNAKnXr9gYgw.text: The food was good but the service needs improvement. Our waitress didn't come around frequent enough to refill our drinks. What made the experience even more negative was being brushed off by one of the other waitresses when one of my coworkers couldn't get help from our assigned waitress. The waitress who brushed off my coworker did eventually come back to check in on the coworker's needs. I understand that she may have been busy but the way it was handled was not customer friendly. I supposed the root is needing more workers on the floor so the workers aren't stretched.  At the end of the day, the food was good but the services wasn't.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States

gWl2kWnSlJNTmUYyu7ZgDw.text: Visited Cornish pasty for the first time as I had bookmarked this place long ago. It was a weekday when my husband and I decided to go here- we got there around an hour before closing time (11pm) and there were a few people around , we weren't alone!  Upon reading reviews I was confused between the veggie rosemary chicken & veggie Asiago chicken pasty - the server recommended the latter.  The veggie Asiago spicy chicken pasty took pretty long to be served - wasn't spicy at all (not even mild) although it mentioned that it contains some chilies. Pretty bland for my taste buds with no flavor nor spice. The salsa served along was pretty good but I came in for the pasty and I was pretty disappointed. Hubby ordered beer and tandoori chicken wings and he loved it.  The server seemed to be having a rough day - asked for a straw for my glass of water and she decided to just dunk it in my glass in a rough way. While taking our plates and silverware after we were done she didn't hold the plate up straight and so the knife fell on my wrist hurting me (no apologies as such whatsoever). I didn't say anything but was definitely in no mood to tip for this service -sorry!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. Veggie Spicy Asiago Chicken -  Vegan Pasties

FMKSOJDQZXQ2tkvDL9ZAjg.text: 40 different pasties - pasties are like favorite meals ie-guiness stew, shepherds pie, meatballs, italian meats and cheese, chicken tikka, turkey dinner, cheese burger and list goes on.  Anyways then wrapped in a delicious pizza like bread crust.  Beers 32oz is 10$ all day.  Sweet eh?  I've never taken an out of towner or in-towner that didn't love this place and want to come back.   Fabulous!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. Burger
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. Italian
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. Shepherds pie

brkr7q7PxJ6VU04bZqYlyA.text: Love love love the Greek chicken pasty! The setting of the restaurant is my favorite it's very intimate but spacious and dim inside but if you choose to eat out side the patio in the back is perfect (if it isn't hot outside, I prefer it night time it's pretty romantic!) they have vegan and vegetarian options and they're pretty tasty as well. The customer service isn't the worst or the best. I think the waiters strategy is not let you enjoy your meal with you cane with or if you came alone. Rather than coming back every 5 mins and bothering you. However it can also be a negative if you need a refill. Anyway, this will always be one of the best spots in AZ!!!

l4EBI6k-XOwK4cvy-gTnNA.text: I cannot believe I've never written a review on Cornish Pasty. I used to come all the time back in the day 10 years ago as the one and only original location. Sadly, I forgot about this place. We were in the area and I immediately thought of Cornish Pasty as my husband never been.  I definitely have great memory because I knew exactly where it was and I even went to the original main door, which is not the main door anymore! They expanded and not just expanded in just this restaurant but in different locations! Good for you, CP.   We took a seat and I ordered the Royale w/ cheese and hubby ordered the Spicy Asiago. The winner of the two was the Royale w/ Cheese. We also ordered two cocktails: hubby ordered the Moscow mule and I ordered the Cornish 69. Both were delicious and strong!!! One thing I highly appreciated is that it didn't take forever to bake our pasty. I remember it used to take at least 30-45 minutes but times have changed. It took about 15-20 min to get our order on our table.   We also decided to order the chocolate banana bread pudding and that was amazing!!! We didn't leave a bite on our plate. Total of our bill was around $56 and definitely worth it!!!

V-S_xk3dso0fT4ZhSHlKqg.text: Badass food, chill vibe, perfect lighting, and not a TV in sight. AND BEERS on BEERS. If you caint find a beer u like then u don't like beer.  I had the Chicken Pesto with marinara and it was perfect as usually. We also had the Meatball appy. It's wrapped in bacon and cooked in beer. So what's not to love bout that? This is my favorite local cause it's a proper English bar minus the fights. When you walk in it feels like a big ol comfy couch.

3DaVmykIImuG9EDKtUBKaA.text: Cornish Pasty has never done me wrong.  First they are a great place to bring a large party to without any reservations.  We had a birthday party tonight with 11 people and we're able to get a large table no problem.    The Pasty's are delicious! I have been her emanh times with many different people and I have never heard anyone say the didn't like what they ordered.  I myself have had the Pesto chicken, Tikka masala, carne adovada, pilgrim, the Italian and all of them have been so tasty.  This location is always dark inside and loud, count on intimate conversations here.    They also have a great assortment of beer on draft and so many bottles beers.  Lastly try the soup if you ever get a chance, it's yummy too.  This place has a great bar, large tables with church pews for seating, and great large patio for outdoor seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States

C5gRTK_a5dWFZC1eybA3mA.text: The food was pretty delicious and the staff is super cool. I like that this spot is open late and the atmosphere is very lax. The pool tables add a nice element to the place and make a spot a bit more interesting too. I got the Chicken Tikki Masala and it was really Good with Tasini sauce they have

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken Tikka Masala

OVPJ3ktsfvXMLeJ90qJxgQ.text: I love this place because they are consistent and their vegan/vegetarian options are straight up delicious. The back bar has free pool and we love to hang out here on weekends. Their cocktails are also so good, my favorite is The Sage. They play cool music, offer attentive service and the environment is relaxed with intimate dim lighting. One of my favorite establishments in Tempe.

tABPsswlO9UGj0pVGzgLoA.text: Guilty pleasures here!  Ridiculous homemade bread, shared pasty and creamy mustard sauce.  All in a cozy and dark pub that felt like a total refuge on a 112 degree day.  Ok I may have added a cold crisp cider to top it off.   Just a yummy and filling and home-y pub.

5_YEKt7DKfrlF9NWBu4Vhg.text: If you like delicious pasties, London pub-esque atmosphere, and good beers, this restaurant is a must visit. The menu differs from location to location, same goes for the beer list. I love the rosemary chicken or any vegetarian options for the pasties and the tandoori wings are superb.  Should you come here, you need to try at least one of their dessert options. My favorite is the sticky toffee pudding, this is really good after eating something savory. Great bar service too!

BlB_hEMn0ICeKf13uApuvw.text: I just love Cornish Pasty. This is the original location and it offers several different ways to experience the atmosphere. If you are interested in a relaxed, couch darker bar and a billiards or music experience, simply enter the side if Cornish known to the locals as The Beast. Certain Saturdays they have DJ's spinning it up and dancing. If you prefer less of a crowd and enjoy the old school diner experience, enter the center of the establishment where you can watch all the neat cooking of the kitchen. If you wish to meet up with several family and friends, you may enjoy the restaurant side where there is a bar and many tables. The tables are actually old church pews and create a unique ambiance. You may also enjoy the great AZ weather on the huge dog friendly patio.  The food will certainly not disappoint as they have pasty's of all types. The Pasty derived from the old mining days where a quick handy meal was easy to pick up and eat on the go. They also have tasty scotch eggs, baked wings, and a supper yummy mushroom walnut soup like no other.   If you have not been, feel free to check out the main location as it's a local gem or the also have a smaller location on Milk Avenue a mile away, a location in Chandler and a location in Scottsdale.

o1R9wZn464wxmP30Ce15lQ.text: My husband had previously been here and insisted we visit this place when we were in Phoenix for Christmas break! I'm so glad he did. It's unlike any other restaurant I've eaten at. They were out of the homemade chips which I heard are a must but we had homemade bread with fresh butter. Heaven! For main course we both had the vegetarian chicken tikka pasty! It's made with Quorn chicken which is a vegan alternative to meat. The flavors were very authentic and the pastry crust was crisp, fresh and well cooked. Would love to eat here again next time I'm there.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States

aMAOcUl85BWSF4jlTckYpA.text: This place was phenomenal! We all had a $4 Irish car bomb to start the evening ! My daughter got the mashed potatoes and broccoli they were to die for! Four other adults at the table all got different pasty's and they were fantastic! Crispy flakey crust! Meaty filling ! Yummy pipping hot potatoes! Definitely will be back ! Something you wouldn't expect from the outside !!!

0ylpWs-5AOVLlsNGWfrGng.text: I have heard great things about this place just located in the downtown Tempe area. I do appreciate how the lighting is nice and dim that fits with the ambiance of the food and drinks provided. I have never really understood the menu specialties, and it was simply put as a calzone style of meals. With that I went with the meatball pastie, that included fresh sliced meatballs, basil, fresh marinara and mozzarella. This pastie is one of many that they offer depending on your cravings.  Next time I will make an effort to try out the other Pasties and the wonderful flavors to expect !

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. Meatball Pastie
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. Boddington pub ale

hA8Z_k5JPLPbI2b9REoKCA.text: I have a small history with pasties.  Having close friends that have been eating pasties since before Christ was born + hanging around said friends for 20 years = a small history with pasties.  I recently heard about this place on Yelp and every time I saw the name, I managed to over and over mis-read it as pastry.  My only defense is that I keep getting those forwards from folks that say it doesn't matter the order of the letters or even if all of them are there, you're brain will figure it out anyway.  i guess this time my brain figured wrong.  I digress...  It never occurred to me that this little known dish would have it's own establishment run in its honor.  Of course, once I finally clued in that it was pasty and not pastry and stopped acting like someone hopped up on pills, I naturally invited my pasty-lovin' friends to share in the experience.  They too were elated at the variety of pasty options and the fact this was the restaurant's purpose and specialty.  An added bonus is how f'n cheap it is.  Talk about a steal!  This place was packed!  Someone said to get there before 8 or 830, but it was 7 and overflowin'.  We managed to fit 5 of us in the awkward geometrical booth built for 3.  My two pasty veterans ordered the Oggie with ketchup since that's what they grew up on (minus the rutabaga).  They both liked it, but thought it was a little spicy due to the rutabaga and the fact they are both ridiculously sensitive to spice induced heat.  One of their sig others ordered a chicken pasty of some sort which he thought was just okay.  The other +1 and I had the shepherd's pie and there wasn't a crumb to be found on either plate.    Our waitress seemed completely unfriendly and a little standoff-ish.    She warmed up as the meal progressed, chatted with us, and she ended up being a great waitress.  One of the guys drinks diet coke like he's in some sort of contest.  After he downed the first one in record time and the waitress gave him a curious "you need a refill already" look, he warned her that he drinks a lot of diet coke and will be gettin' a lot of refills.  About two minutes later she came back with a pitcher so he could refill till his thirst is content.  Rock star move on her part.  We all left full, happy, and ready for the next phase of the evening.  I'll definitely be back again - maybe even for lunch since I work relatively close.  Just remember pasty, not pastry.  Yum!

ZQAXnWYx95_tYCVgHUQXwg.text: Loved that place (great pastys) until I found a hair - hopefully not of pubic origin - on my last visit (in February 2013)....

1OE_QaHBF_umti75u0f6Bg.text: Absolutely love this place.  A usual lunch spot for me and my team members.  After the expansion things were slow for a bit while the staff got the kinks worked out, now it is great!

r1fSPlSXRaF1TwjSq2ZFCA.text: The food is divine. I wish I worked/lived closer. The are super friendly and fast. The place is a cave, but you don;t notce once you take a bite.

Nf19R55dPUmJXEPd9MXXqQ.text: These pasties are huge.  I mean they're bigger than Janet Jackson's breasts, and they are a steal at $7 or so.   So for value, quality and portions this is probably among your best bets in Tempe.  Punk rock and British pub grub are predictable and go together like PB&J, but Cornish Pasty is probably one of the more distinctive restaurants in the Valley for its niche of pasties in a quick service restaurant/diner setting.  My buddy was in town visiting and staying in Tempe wanted something unique for the area.  Given that he's used to Mexican, I opted for Cornish Pasty since it was nearby.  My friend couldn't finish his Oggie, with steak, potato, onion & rutabaga, but I couldn't resist polishing off the Cajun, blackened chicken breast, bacon, ham and swiss, served with an addictive side of chipotle sauce.  Spicy, but not overwhelming, but a bit on the greasy side as a warning.   The beer selection here is admirable, and had we not had to go back to work for the man that day, we would have certainly indulged.  Kronenbourg, Boddington's and Strongbow on tap, plus your expected hipster brews available by the bottle: Chimay and Rogue among them. The setting looks diner-ish with its long narrow strip mall set-up and open kitchen.  The atmosphere here is dark and weathered, but not dumpy.    The difficulty here is deciding on a pasty.  I could have easily gone for a meat and cheese, a Mexican pasty, or chicken tikka masala. Luckily, our server was very knowledgeable about the different pasties as we couldn't make up our mind, so his recommendations were well taken.

8SwSPJMtTgRhKz7VyJ7sRg.text: All I can really say is WOW!  I absolutely love this place... The Carne Adovada is by far my favorite, and a close second is the Spicy Asiago chicken.  The service is always great, and the renovations they've made to the joint are wonderful - it's really a very pleasant place to visit.

oHzWCCSN5g9YhwZH_-tb8w.text: Great food. I'm not a huge fan of how dark and loud it is inside (Tempe location), but the food was great and our server was top notch. She even let the 5 of us have our own checks without a bat of the eye. Highly recommended.

GVg-2TlKrxMiVA3sXScKPg.text: Cornish is my favorite restaurant in Tempe. Great beer selection and dark quiet seating areas make it a great date spot. The place is always freezing cold though which is not good for me because I get cold easily.   Try any of the desserts they are amazing!!! The british treacle and cream one is my favorite.

RSeOJpyBdON_NN27TWe99w.text: I'm in LOVE with Cornish Pasty Co!  If you've never had a pasty (pass-tee) before, picture a big pocket made from buttery-flaky crust and filled with your heart's desire!  They have nearly a dozen delicious, vegetarian pasties to choose from!  I love the Veggie Oggie filled with veggie-steak, potatoes, rutabaga and onions.  Mmmmm!  Pre-order 45 minutes before hand and they'll custom make you a vegan one!  My only complaint?  Since the place is so small it can really heat up because of the ovens.  Be prepared, it can get pretty hot in there!

d359j1Qwi-HglSIfbNtmvw.text: I love this place. If your looking for a good English treat, this is the place to go. The food is phenomenal and the atmosphere is fun. My favorite pic is "The Pilgrim", which has Turkey, stuffing, sweet potatoes, and comes with a side of cranberry sauce. My husband, who is a vegetarian always gets the vegetarian Shepard's Pie, which he loves.  The only two things that I think could be improved on is the inside of the restaurant is hot hot hot in the summer (better air conditioning). And, there could be more space (it's pretty cramped) for seating. Especially if there is more than 2 people in your party.

Wh5YLrQpHAVidLUUBefGuA.text: So before I moved to manage the new Sack's location on the west side, I had put in my time at the University & Hardy locale-- putting the Cornish Pasty Co. in ridiculously close proximity to myself and the other happy hour enthusiasts I happened to work with.  I still call over to that location to see if anyone there wants to give me an excuse to make the drive across town to meet for a Black Velvet. Hello, my name is Kara... and I'm an unabashed alcoholic.    So if you're following along, when we meet at Pasty Co, I'll already be full from a Sack's sandwich-- but as soon as I smell the baking dough & simmering spices, I'll be perusing the amply stocked vegetarian section of the menu and trying to decide between my three favorites-- The Mexican, The Rosemary Chicken, and the Tikka Masala.  And man alive, you can't drink at a place that's got such a great pub-style atmosphere and not have a great pub-style ale of which they have many.  That's my only complaint about this place-- I am compelled to eat hearty, drink hearty, and be merry until I about burst at the seams.    Managing a kitchen myself, I'm continuously amazed at what they can do with what little space they have!  Their seating area is only a bit longer and wider than their kitchen/prep area which is open to ogle and runs parallel to the grubbing area.  I enjoy sitting at the bar to spy on the process and trying to catch the staff eavesdropping on our loud bar banter.  I love when someone mashing potatoes chuckles at our drunken philosophy sessions.    Parting Tip: As mentioned in other reviews, and their claim to fame (rightly so)-- $3 Irish Car Bombs! (I've seen places charge $6!!!). Oh, and don't forget the Banoffee Pie for dessert.  They make their own whip cream!

7ZWoN4Zlvtqp8oieGJNlPg.text: I do not even know where to start with Cornish Pasty they have mastered the English food restaurant in this area. The ambiance is out of this world the food is to die for and the beer list is as good as it is long!. I have taken multiple parties here and enjoyed it every time. The Staff is possibly some of the coolest and most respectful and fun people i have ever have serve me and the owner will take the time to walk around and talk to you and his patrons. 5 Stars and that is a rarity!

0eWJvWmC0lpkH0BQUJPr9w.text: This place is great! I took my mom before a play and we didn't experience any of the slow service that others mentioned. The food was unique and tasty. We each picked a pasty of our choice and then split the mushy peas and roasted potatoes. Top it off with tapped hard cider and I was in oral heaven.  There was far too much food for two people to eat in one sitting. These little sandwiches are deceptively filling. And the incredible number of options from which to select from is a little mind boggling. My suggestion would be just to settle on one and then figure on a few return visits to round out the list.  Tables are tight, so this is definitely not a place to take the whole posse, but that's not a huge down-grade. The music is fairly loud and as I mentioned, I was there early, so I can only imagine that it must get really loud when the place is full. Amazingly, mom commented that she liked the music (who knew she was a Green Day fan) and thought the atmosphere was charming (not how I would have described it, but clearly its a place that is even parent friendly). She already has picked out her next two choices for return visits...  A couple of things that really stood out to me: 1) You can get the Oggie (the basic pasty) partially cooked for a buck less than the menu price - then take it home and finish off the baking for that fresh out of the oven taste - very cool. 2) If you want desert, you have to order it first or share food, because there is no way to finish everything - sammie and side - and still want for more. 3) I've spent a lot of time in the mother land and don't remember the food every being this flavorful... but who really cares, this is good eats and did I mention the tapped hard cider?? (takes me to my happy place)!  This is a great unique food alternative for the down town Tempe area.

G8wHCsEusGbMoDUqcni75g.text: What's a pasty? G-d-like predesessor of the hot pocket! CPC is a great place for carnivores, omnivores, and veggies alike (probably vegans as well). They offer a huge menu ranging from Indian- inspired pasties to more traditional English versions. It's difficult, but save room for desert! There have been many stressful nights when all I wanted was to trade my periodic table and graphing calculator in for one of their apple caramel pasties. I have also heard wonderful things about the Strawberry Pavlova and the Banoffee Pie.

wEIPtAdn-or4TRYmuDzIPg.text: Service was awesome had a waitress that was very attentive and gave great recommendations! Leak soup by far one of the best soups I have ever tried. Very unique food but good

6DVYBKe0fopFa68vAkq9Dg.text: As if this place needs more high marks.  I used to drive by the place all the time and my so at the time used to joke about Cornish Pastys being what Cornish strippers wore in non nude establishments.  All I can say is yum!  So one day, we took the plunge and stopped by after work.  It's dark but not dank.  Narrow but not crowded.  Tasty but not super fast.  Pasty may not be a good every day staple.  But it sure is tasty!  I have tried at least a half dozen menu items and none have steered me wrong but for the real "flava" I'm gonna recommend you stick with the more traditional stuff.  Otherwise you could just end up eating a calzone in disguise and seriously... who wants to eat a Cornish calzone?  The staff is nice, and friendly.  The vibe is decent and if you like meat (or veggies)  and potatoes (which may technically be a veggie but is class by itself you know) stuffed into delicous bread.  You will feel as if you have died and gone to heaven.  Do not be fooled by cheap imitations! This is not some gussied up hot pocket or some savory pop tart! This is the real deal!  After eating this you'll be ready to go into a coal mine and work for .. well no. That may be stretching the truth.  But the food is really good.  One time, I preordered from this place and got a bunch of parbaked Pasties for a Christmas Eve celebration.  They were a big hit.

0a4wPkWxr7xgTBY46_xF7g.text: When people talk about heaven on earth, be aware...they are discussing the Cornish Pasty Co.  This place is A-MA-ZING...oh yes, it must be sounded out.  I had friends in town from San Fransisco and they surfed Yelp to find a good place to eat in Phoenix...Cornish Pasty Co sounded awesome...and totally lived up to our expectations.  So much so that after eating there one night, we returned the night after for another round!  We sampled quite a few things from their menu...the Royale with Cheese was badass, the Chicken Alfredo pleasant, the Cajun wickedly delicious and spicy...and don't forget the Pilgrim, which is like having Thanksgiving bundled up and delivered to you in a wonderfully delicious pasty package.  AND the portions are big enough that you can eat half and be full, so the goodness can be enjoyed as a heated up lunch the next day!  BUT WAIT, THERE IS MORE!  We couldn't resist dessert...  Night One:  Banoffee Pie.  Thick layer of graham cracker, wickedly thick layer of RICH caramel, a spattering of banana slices and then fresh whipped cream.  FREAKIN AWESOME.  AND IT GETS EVEN BETTER!!!!  Night Two:  Peanut Butter and Jelly Pasty.  Imagine amazing pastry smothered in chunky peanut butter, drizzled with raspberry jelly and encasing bananas...now top that with some more pastry, more jelly and whipped cream...not the sickening sweet shit that comes in cans...fresh, cool awesomeness disguised as a white blob.  THIS is the amazing Peanut Butter and Jelly Pasty...God's gift to man.    My advice...SEEK OUT CORNISH PASTY CO, ALL YE FOOD LOVERS!!!  You will NOT be disappointed.

qhjn7RaCh_94tZ1_XdNG6g.text: I love this place as much as I love the English accent.  Cornish Pasty is moved beyond expectation by its consistent vision of, quality products, fresh food and employees that love the food so much one can taste it.   What else can a yelper ask from this location.  Its hard to find location but once you know its always a debat, Cheba Hut or Cornish Pasty, sometimes it depends what I did earlier in the day.     Its so hard to give 5 stars out but this place deserves it, I can't deny the whole experience and the restaurants dedication to food.   I also heard they have a great deal for Irish Car bombs.

dOnSqQzgLiHsYF8k6nhvCg.text: If I were ever to be executed, I'd want a Meat & Cheese pasty for my last meal. With two red wine gravy.  It's *that* good.

xSYunuSddiBqE2ki7p-BDw.text: I really don't get what the big deal is about with this place. I went after reading all the rave reviews by other Yelpers last evening before heading to Gammage to see Wicked. For the first time, I went to a Yelp-recommended place and was very disappointed.   First of all, the place is a dump. It's run down and kind of dirty...or at least gives off a dirty feel.I have seen the new Pasty that is over on Guadalupe in Mesa and the decor is very nice and it's clean.  This location is not wheelchair friendly at all and don't bother bringing more than 4 people unless you plan to stand at the bar.   I'm not sure if they were employees or just friends of the employees who were working there but there was a group of college age guys hanging around both behind the counter pouring their own drinks and lounging in front of the counter who were just filthy. They had dirty beards, dirty hair, dirty ripped up clothes....I had no idea that the new look in college guys was homeless-chic.    The food was....eh. My son had the meat and cheese pasty and I had the rueben. We shared our pasties and I was no more impressed with the meat and cheese than I was with the rueben. They weren't bad...they were just eh at best. You get the pasty...no side dish, no salad, no nothing. It's not really a value.   Our server was pleasant but nothing special. She served our food and kept our cokes filled. It was clear that the focus was on the bar. There were about 9 people just hanging out at the bar, which is fine, but the place isn't advertised as a bar. I had brought my 8 year old son and this place is really not kid friendly given the amount of attention given to the bar and the dirty patrons/employees who were hanging around.   If I do go back to Cornish Pasty it will likely be at the newer location which is why I give it 2 stars and not 1 because as a chain, it might be worth the 2nd visit. This one is just not worth the drive from the West Valley.

nWwEo6nLeW30CQ8Gh11jrw.text: Great service, great food.  I just need to go another 15 times so I can try all the vegetarian pasties.  I should know better than to order a side though, but was told by our server that the broccoli and cauliflower bake was really good.  Didn't care for it.  Wished I would have saved my 5 bucks.

D1eysUW3wBi14hlFbtlevg.text: this go-around, i ordered the cottage pasty, vegetarian. filled with quinoa meat and lots of potatoes and veggies. it was divine. the wife and i split the banana desert with graham cracker crust and caramel drizzle....caramel dollop that is.   super rich and sweet. it was delicious but i felt my teeth hurting afterwards. we'll go a little more savory next time!  still an awesome place with over excellent service.

-16FR5jeQh1FMLNXQ1mT9g.text: Absolutely delicious.  For a family of four we ordered three and it was perfect.  Cool vibe and everything on the menu looked awesome and we couldn't decide which of the pasties we liked best.  Royale with cheese, Carne adovada and the Shepherd pie were all excellent.

i3eAOPTVY4NX6Xxh9QrJVQ.text: My first time trying Cornish Pasty and I will definitely be back! I loved everything! Their beer selection, specialty cocktails and food was outstanding!

trxyZBPZYaUnDVH6AcIksQ.text: One of the things I love about my neighborhood is that Cornish Pasty is w/in walking distance.  Every pasty Ive had here is awesome. My personal faves include the shepherds pie, the chicken pot pie, and the thanksgiving pasty.  Yes its tiny and loud, but it adds to the charm. Also, the smell that you smell right when you walk in the door= heaven.  We eat in and get to go. Tip for to go: have a beer or a cider w/ your wait.

wBkFckYeRaUXlWFnedOrTw.text: Man, my Yelp peeps did it again! We were in a food experimental mood so decided to check this place.  Boy, did it not disappoint!  The place looked a little "shady" weren't clear we were at the right place. Inside is dark, cool music, cool tables and staff. Our service was fast. We wanted for nothing. Our food was crazy good. Served to us piping hot! I ordered the Shepherds Pie and my husband ordered the A bit of Salmon. Dang good food. You owe it to yourself to eat here.

6hvLh64vZIJ0uKEHwTR4mw.text: I went here a while ago and tried the rosemary chicken and it was excellent. Every bite was delicious. I have been wanting to go back for months now and I keep looking at the menu thinking of what I will order, but I can't get the rosemary chicken out of my mind! I wish I could try them all but I think I'll just end up ordering the same thing again.

VnfRdAV35YppWzoQzz1vUQ.text: The service gets more and more dismissive every time I come here.  I wait longer and longer to be acknowledged and the waiting periods of being ignored after initial contact get bigger. At this point, I feel like coming back here knowing this is comparable to holding your breath under water...the longer you wait, the more it sucks; but for some inexplicable reason you keep trying to outdo yourself and beat the clock. But the beer is cold and the pasties are tasty...and one day I'll remember to wear my horn rimmed glasses and not cover up my sleeve tats, maybe that will help.

MB5b7Nz8FBRhmYkpF3y5SA.text: I'm a little late posting this but figured it was better late than never: the following happened a few months ago at the Tempe location.  Let me start off by saying I really, really like the food and they have a great selection of beer. The problem was with a waitress (she's blonde and thin) and how she treated me during our last and final visit to this restaurant. During our meal, I asked for a recommendation for a beer and gave her characteristics of beer I like as well as a recommendation for a pasty (I am really not picky but I cannot handle a lot of spice). I ordered both things she recommended and both turned out to be really not what I wanted at all. She recommended a beer that was really hoppy (when I had told her I like pilsners) and a spicy indian pasty that had a lot of curry (I'm sure it would be great for people who can handle spicy food--just a reminder that my issue with this restaurant is not with the food). During our meal she was really inattentive and it took around 30 minutes to get our check after we had asked for it. Because my boyfriend owed me money from earlier that day, I tipped lower (around 12%) and he tipped higher (around 30%) so our average tip on our meal was OVER 20%. We decided to leave a good tip because, despite the poor service, he really enjoyed his meal and we have had good experiences there before.   This is where things get really, really bad.   After leaving, I realized I left something on our table and approached our waitress and she gave it to me. After I thanked her, she said "thanks for the (expletive) bad tip." I could not believe that she cursed at me for a tip that was over 20% and I was completely dumbfounded. I tried to find the manager but was unable to. It's a real shame that she ruined my experience with Cornish Pasty. All of my friends I was with as well as others have vowed to not go back there.

nPzJop1CFS-JGEqb65ZqqA.text: If you like Cornish Pasties, then you'll dig this place. Their traditional 'flavors' are spot on with what you'd get across the pond in the UK.  They also have a LOT of non-traditional versions - like a chicken tikka.  And if you have no clue what a pasty is, but you like things like pot pies or even hot pockets, then give this place a go.  Good selection of beers, too.  Only thing to be aware of is that the place sort of looks closed (or even out of business) from the side entrance. Don't let that fool or deter you.

GNTnOTWhPB0lEOrVIG59pQ.text: I'm very interested in Celtic culture, so this place piqued my interest. How authentic is it, you may ask? I couldn't tell you because I've never been to Cornwall, but the pasties are good! If you've never had a pasty before, think empanadas, but with gravy, potatoes, lamb and peas and carrots inside.  They also have non-traditional pasties as well, with stuffings to make them resemble calzones and other foods.   I also really like the feel of the place, and how they've re-purposed several random items for decorations.   I'd really like to go back for drinks, as I feel like this would be a very laid-back, chill drinking atmosphere. And hipster heaven.  ...sometimes I wonder if I'm secretly a hipster, but then I think, what hipsters spend time wondering what kind of societal label they fit into? I think not. =)   Anywho - come here and try a pasty!

8ttNdyFZaNfVZFVAzE2Ysg.text: Came to the Cornish Pasty, by the looks of the outside, knew instantly it was the type of English dive I would love. Once inside seen the tattoo'ed waitresses, cooks, and bar tenders and knew this place was way above my expectations. Once I looked over the menu, which is extensive, had to decide on a meal. Went with the Shepard's Pie, made with minted ground lamb, veggies, and mashed potatoes, inside a pastry. Crazy I know, but absolutely fantastic. Staff was attentive and wanted to make sure my experience was great. Definitely be back next time I'm in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. Yes it really was that good!!
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States

pevHJK35q9w_VJVLz0qkbQ.text: Noisy, not clean, weak service. There is no presentation effort in the service. There is a pasty on a metal plate. I will not return. The food is nothing more than a sub sandwich that is wrapped in dough and put in a quick oven. I can get that at Jimmie Johns with quicker, better service in a cleaner establishment.

PZXC2U3tV733kFnq3o03RQ.text: I came here to  this Tempe location only once, about 2 months ago with a ethnic dining MeetUp.  If anyone ventures to order the lamb and mint cornish pasty, please let me know if you find any meat in it!  Cos I couldn't find any in mine, just layers and layers of potatoes.  When I later told another ethnic dining buddy that I wasn't going back to Cornish Pasty, he (not eating with me, but went another time) said he ordered same and could not find the lamb in it, either.  He even told the manager, who said the "cook musta made a mistake and forgot the lamb".  See if they "make a mistake" on yours, too.  If you order another lamb pasty, LMK if you find the lamb in that one, too.  Eating these pasties is like "mining".  You don't see what you are getting till you get there with your mouth and fork, cos it visually hidden inside the pastry shell, so you keep digging and digging for the lamb.  Cost me $12 + for a "potato pasty" incl tax and tip.  BaaaahhhhhhD.

F5aUhml_JOJjg7hgRdY3Lw.text: Great food and atmosphere! Love the cider! They also have an entire page dedicated to vegetarian menu items!

1l04WNdY9DW5Utz2pEnZ1Q.text: Great place for food and chillaxin...  Pasties take a while to prep and cook so be patient...it's worth it.

KTy4CIBFrKZ6VFZfVZxqVQ.text: Yum!  Saw this on "Check please, Arizona" and have been wanting to try it for a long time!  Luckily, my friend loves this place and invited me to join her.  They've recently expanded and also have an outdoor patio area.  The inside is dark and super cozy.  You can still see the kitchen from your seat which is pretty cool.  Great selection of beers, too.  My friend and I ordered two pasties then shared them.  We got the chicken pot pie which was yum and the chicken pesto which is my favorite.  I wish I had room for desert because I'd love to try the carmel apple pasty!  Will definately be coming here again!  Our server was super awesome and nice, too!

9OrRfQaqnuDHIMSeyNDijw.text: Have to give 5 stars for Cornish Pasty! It used to be hard to get into this location as it was so tiny.  Now it's all expanded and plenty of room for everyone.  And that's a good thing as this place gets busy!  But the food is excellent - I usually vacilate between the Ruben, the Italian,  or the Royale with Cheese, but I have sampled many more and there are bound to be a few selections you will love!  I always realize it's been too long since my last visit when I go here!

K-okfata3sl0uzLzwSG1sw.text: I came here with some fiends because they really love this place and raved how good their pasty is. I was blown away how AMAZING they are. They have so much variety of pasties and also had a full page of VEGAN/ VEGETARIAN options for me. It is so hard to find a place with delicious, no scratch that, highly delightful to the taste buds place like this. I am going here again this weekend and trying me another delicious package of phenomenon. I love you Cornish Pasty. Please be my cicisbeo.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. Veggie Mexican.
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. Someone did not like his pasty.
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. Dead dude with pasty.

gAa9SAQqdecD_gAvVHU9QA.text: Was in town for the Great American Foodie Fest. Went in with my crew & was surprised by the hipsterish vibe. Our waitress Kasie was upbeat & attentive. The Guinness pasty was so delicious paired with my draft Boddingtons. Thanks AZ for not disappointing!

UOSyT87PPL636UzHE9RhwA.text: First time here after hearing great things.  It didn't disappoint.  DH had the Bangers and mash I had Cottage Pie.  Both were excellent.  Perfectly brown and flaky crust.  But the Apple pastry dessert definitely finished off.  If I could go for a bottle of cider and apple pastry I would have left Happy!!!  Will definitely go back when we're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States

NAqG6ppYZ9RHnGfH3Uv6gQ.text: God, I love this place. Every location is awesome. The food is always great. I've never had a single problem other than having to wait because it's packed with so many other people enjoying the awesomeness.   While I do love the pasties, it's great to venture to other areas of the menu as well. Their handmade soups are fantastic and I try to always save room for some. I've had both the Pavlova and the dessert pasty and I could go in for those alone.  They usually have great music playing and the service is always friendly.

r_RO3NuGtc7XFnIX0y7JbA.text: Absolutely amazing! Staff and food was awesome and great place ! It's not fancy and not a fine and dine restaurant but it's what you expect for an English pub style restaurant. Pasty of all different kinds and has a wide variety for vegetarians. This is a must stop in Tempe...

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. Bangers and Mash Pasty!!

VpQLuOs0onz_59O1_cmvoQ.text: All the pasties are delicious, I love taking new people here so they can check it out.  So far nobody has complained.  Very happy that they have 10x the seating now.

vxGAzx0SdBO4bFWbY2Mg1w.text: Ordered cornish pasty on door dash, the pasties were fine but when we took a bite of the banoffee pie, instead of whipped cream it was covered in sour cream. Called to tell them and their only response was it's impossible. Not impossible, very clearly sour cream in both taste and smell. They refused to acknowledge there was an issue, much less do anything about it. A very sour ending to our meal.  My guess is a lazy employee didn't feel like whipping the cream and grabbed the already creamy sour cream, putting that in the confectioners bag instead.   ,

V5tvsVLoc2XNxyfg7JdJ0g.text: Wonderful food, and the service is superb!  Wife ordered the Cottage Pie pasty--it was outstanding!  Don't forget the red wine gravy--yummm!  I had the Cajun pie--it was excellent.  We shared the Caramel Apple pie for dessert, and it was amazing!  Definitely go out of your way to try this place--you won't be disappointed!  P.S.  Tip to the owners--open a location in Northern California.  You will make a fortune here!

UL3kLnKhZHIP8f4H3sjquA.text: Delicious beer, even delicious-er pasties. If I could live here, I would.   There's maybe nothing I would improve upon except slightly faster service. But even then, I've never gone here while I was in a rush so that's never been a major issue.   The Pilgrim is my favorite, but my friend recently ordered the beef abodobe or something like that and it looked so good I thought about murdering him so I could take it. Ultimately I decided I was too full to eat it, but that guy knows to watch his back now.

zQMp6zl1DLQ80sfA4e_Izg.text: Fancy hot-pockets?! Amazing. They have a great vegetarian & vegan selection as well. A little annoying that you're not able to change the ingredients in the standard pockets (they're pre-made), but they do offer a huge selection that helps make up for it. The atmosphere is laid back & great place to grab a drink & make new friends at the community tables or the bar.

-RO_jdQlmf-j1RYtesj27A.text: Probably one of the best English foods I have ever had. Their pasties definitely pack in the flavors, not very well known for English food. I would highly recommend The Royal with Cheese. It's sort of their twist of a hamburger and fries stuffed in a calzone. The servers are very friendly and welcoming. Give this place a try, you are in for a pleasant surprise :)  The only issue I have is how long it take to make one once you have ordered. I would suggest to call ahead and order before eating there. I can understand the high price for just one pasty (around $9 per pastey not including a side) because they make each one by hand with fresh ingredients. The restaurant can work on the interior design as its a bit confusing, a mix between modern and old style English pub. Not a big fan of the church pews for seats because its hard to sit upright while eating. Its just awkward. If you can look past the odd decor, this place in not at all that bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. The Royal w/ cheese

f-7KHdBRh1V26h1i-JyN1Q.text: The Excellent:  * They're open late!  * The pasties reheat really well @50% power, which was my primary goal. I bought 4 of them for a couple days of food in my hotel room while in town for work.   The Good * The Pasties: Lamb and Mint, Shepherds pie, italian, and Bangers and Mash. (Bangers and mash and italian were my favorite). I tried all 4 the night I bought them, when they were hot and fresh.  * They were a little dry (particularly the lamb ones), and it would have been nice to have some sauce INSIDE the pasty (maybe that makes them soggy though?) * The red wine sauce was really good, but was a little salty when I added enough to help with the dryness.   The Bad:  * None! Maybe the price is a little high? almost $10 seems a little high... but overall, I was happy.   I will happily go back when stocking up on a few days worth of food.

zwyHYs1I1dbYGGvS6C0Wgw.text: This place is ALWAYS GOOD! Haven't had a pasty I've been disappointed with so far! My favorite is the chicken portobello ! Their oven chips and meatballs for appetizers are great as well! The pastys and made and baked fresh, so it can take a little time to get your food, but it is so worth the wait! Great prices on alcohol! And their desserts are SO good!! My fave is the chocolate bread pudding! A MUST everytime we good!      The only con is the staff/service ! Sometimes we get great servers that are very attentive and keep our drinks filled.. Other times it takes forever to see our server and to get the bill to pay!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States

ALmLoSCw5KPCxvq7P4bZBA.text: The food here is pure awesomeness.  I truly love the cornish pasty company. They offer plenty of healthy alternatives and they have a decent craft beer selection. 2 thumbs up

adKcLCFKIAIZHX-bnEM7Qw.text: Great beer selection and some good pies! what more could you want?

DASQEIxohtqBDHl7kTWsKA.text: Been a longtime customer and the food remains excellent but the customer service needs improvement. We had angry students serve my family  last week, one of them literally slammed our dinner plates on the table. To Go orders are  what I'm doing  from now on.

-4OFsuWFa6dkkF1xJWLmJw.text: Sorry Cornish!  You have a good thing going it seems but need some polishing/cleaning.  The place was doing a really brisk carryout business while we were there.  Very friendly and eclectic staff.  Good beer selection too.  The pasties were tasty but the temperature of the filling when reheated was not consistent - some hot spots, some cool spots.  I worry that this could be a recipe for food illness.  The star killer came just as we were getting ready to leave.  A small roach came crawling out onto the bar in front of us.  GGGAAAAHHHHDDDD.

Kxb3WZNOstlo1dDlv2MhQA.text: Spicy Asiago chicken pasty. That is where it ends. Absolutely delicious! This place has a good beer selection and offers these things known as pasties (the a is not long... It is not pronounced like those stickers you put on your nips... Thanks for the clarification, bearded bartender). You can watch them make the pasties when you sit at the bar. The bread crust is flaky and is stuffed with the pasty of your choosing (get the Asiago chicken!!). It comes with a side of salsa and sour cream. They have plenty of vegetarian options too if you're into that. My boyfriend enjoys the Pilgrim usually. The interior is dark and it was kinda difficult to find the entrance LOL. Pretty hipster joint and the food is top notch. I don't think you can possibly be disappointed.

FrOE75hacjNp7ECPh3qw3g.text: Best pasties on the planet!!!! Awesome atmosphere and delicious food, plus an awesome alcohol selection.

JD6T_f2JbHbO1DIFp4URkg.text: A gem. Hidden in a strip mall but not to be overlooked! Delicious. Try the Reuben pasty or the Royale with Cheese. Dig the theme.

MYbb244mllvEr1TgUyvQLg.text: I'm torn here. Best food ever. Unfortunately their service more or less sucks. They staff the place with 20something hipsters who are all stoned (especially in the kitchen) and think they are too cool for school. Don't let hipsters run a joint. They are only good for smoking them.

N4QT24yDputnKCJV2ijeiw.text: This place is awesome, kind of dark and subdued but totally works, once inside the staff is super helpful and friendly. If you like beer, well they have 20+ handles on tap. The food? The food you ask? AWESOME Cornish Patsy's of every flavor and type! Pork, chicken, beef, veggie, Mexican, Italian on and on and on.... Oh I'm not done, desert Patsy's !!! So FREAKING GOOD! You have to try this place! Great history of how Patsy's came to be, mining theme on the walls. Try it you'll love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Tempe, AZ, United States. Carne abovado!

_Ib5uArlBeYd_hEfbTU5cQ.text: cozy, loud and wonderful place.  delicious food and beer.

re4EUYy5D0tMTwf_xHyU7Q.text: Finally ate here last night after wanting to forever! Got the shepherd's pie pasty and it was so good. Gravy on the side was a perfect addition. Very filling too. As always, the place was pretty crowded but we were seated quickly and I really liked our server. I would definitely go back- and hopefully soon!

oidkyhEmi5mjv1IxyUx8AQ.text: We came here for lunch and were a little leery when we first walked in. I had the cream of leek soup, my mother had the sausage salad, and my aunt had the Greek salad and we were all very impressed. We took a bangers and mash pasty to go, but we are so full, that it'll be awhile before we can try it. The service was a little slow, but the quality of food and atmosphere made up for the inconvenience.

5EsYlkKx44ViFTpn5iMxOA.text: OMG this place was soooooo good and I can't wait to go back for more. My boyfriend and I were headed out to Tempe a couple days ago and I asked him to Yelp some restaurants in the area. He mentioned pastys and all I could think of was pasties that women wear, anyways, I figured that if Yelpers gave it a great review it must be good. As you walk in it is kind of small, yet intimate. Are SUPER tiny waitress came over to take our order (She was super cute and small). My man ordered Cajun Chicken and I ordered the porky pasty with a Boddingtons. MMMM the food came out nice and warm.  I have to be honest that I liked the mans more than mine, his dish was a little spicy and it came with this chipotle style spread that pulled all the flavors together. The porky was good, it reminded me of pub food I have had in Edinburg, Scotland. It was gravy filled with lots of potatoes and meat.  Needless to say, I felt like I needed a nap afterwards; however, we decided to share the PB&J desert and it was GREAT!  Hands down the warmest best PB&J I have ever had.  We ended up paying around $30.00 for 2 bears dinner and desert, not bad.

STtyzUEJl8Dl5Q3B0hP6sw.text: Me and a few buddys went here last weekend after Oktoberfest and I gota say it was even better the second time around!! I had the Lamb Vindaloo, which was VERY spicey... which required more beer.  It was the first time my buddies had been here and all of them really enjoyed their food.

BDCwEGy9hA8k693vhsJSSQ.text: If you haven't been here, you're really missing on something special.  Many friends who have left town make sure to go here on return visits.  For those that don't know, a pasty is essentially a gourmet hot pocket.  They've got everything from standard meat and potatoes to a thanksgiving pasty with all the fixings, and plenty more.  The only pasty I didn't like was one with an ingredient I don't like, so I can't blame them.  I'm not even sure if they have other food, because I always get a pasty or two.  The beer selection is good, and the staff are great and very friendly.  The only downside is that this place is cramped and it can be hard to find a seat at times; there's only one table that can accommodate a crowd (+ the bar).  I hear the new location is better in this regard.

zw4fyBhE9A4PBlQvbH1NVg.text: "Pasties were originally filled with strawberry jam, eaten by miners in the UK. Not very authentic  but I see these ppl got creative" -- my Brit buddy from London.  From my POV: Pretty chillaxed place.  The food is incredibly greasy if you're into that stuff.  It was pretty different for my taste. (Then again, I'm a VERY picky eater) I had the mashers and bangers (mashed potato and pork stuffed into a greasy shell like that on a chicken pot pie except richer in fat). It was so and so. Kind of bland.  Second time around, I had the Italian style one with Salami and other yummy stuff in it. It was much better than the bland mashers and bangers.  I'm 5 ft 1 and 90 lbs, I couldn't finish one full pasty.

EPEc5bpwrlDyAK6wo9sI2Q.text: I love this place... too!   They have the best red curry pasty i have ever eaten.   I wish you had a place in north phoenix though as the drive is a bit far.   In addition to the pastys i really like all the sides such as the rutabaga, and the stilton soup.  Yum!   This place delivers on all counts.

sVATLfC8qoUmBIuswZGF-Q.text: This place is awesome.  Basically they serve gourmet hot pockets in a very cool environment.  These things are awesome.  I don't get to go here enough, but I get the Pilgrim when I do!  I am not a beer guy, but it seems like they have a great selection.

8OvcDsrAQ_ySqME8omNK4A.text: I like this place because of how original it is and the menu has something for everyone.  Unfortunately it is tucked away in a hard to spot location and therefore continues to be a great secret.  I would recommend to anyone in Arizona to make a trip over and see what this place is all about. I think everyone will be happy with it.

bpMlg4Xv6FBvRCcLuQw47Q.text: OK the business is small and very crowded at lunch but beyond that, They make the best food in Tempe, No Joke!  These Paste's are Hot Pockets on Steroids, from Cajun Chicken to the Original Lamb, these things are packed full of flavor and they serve the best beer as well.  So when your tired of Sushi, Pizza and a Steak dinner and you want something that is different but will get you coming back for more. Now they have a new location that is larger in Mesa on Dobson, that will surely be a hit too.

nnRe-PzYGWVHybfVAMEJYw.text: This narrow restaurant is tucked away in a strip mall in Tempe near ASU. Popular among the hippy type, it reminds me of my time in Portland, OR. There are only a handful of two seater tables and one long bar for seating. The restaurant fills up fast at dinner time and is a very tight fit to try to find an open seat among patrons and servers.   I ordered the Royale with Cheese. I would have liked to have it without mushrooms but the pasties are pre-made so no changes or substitutions can be made. Luckily the mushrooms were pretty big and easy to pick out. The pasty was delicious overall but the meat was a bit salty. The menu says it has french fries but they are really just potatoes cut like fries and not actually deep fried. I liked that. I was afraid the french fries would make it too greasy but they were a great addition.   My friend had a Cottage Pie Pasty. He said it was delicious and had no complaints. The red wine sauce complimented it well.  As I noted above, this place can get pretty busy and the servers run around like crazy serving and bussing tables. Service isn't superb but the food really makes up for it. Go here and you won't be disappointed.

xOY-oT7Z0IKFzkkwa6v7fQ.text: The Cornish Pasty Company has great food.  The only thing is to get there early because when the place gets busy the service becomes slow.  The decor is nice and dark which is nice to get out of the sun now and then.  I had the Lamb with mint pasty and also the salmon pasty, both tasted awesome!

Xn83EhgoGNCMy_yfvK9JkA.text: This is the best restaurant to go to when you find yourself unnecessarily grumpy and in need of delicious, inventive cusine.   Cornish Pasty is always a favorite of mine, though I recommend stopping by on a weeknight, or at a less rushed time, as the place is mighty popular, and seating is relatively limited.

VyuFX8CAha5aXsSh37QRYw.text: I love Cornish Pasty Company for the charming atmosphere, great beer selection, and last but not least the food. If you come here sit at the bar and order a cajun chicken. You're welcome!

0fws9Cu4_TesrY8wJ7DP9A.text: Wow, never have I though that pub food could be this delicious. Cornish Pasty Co. is by definition a hole in the wall well worth driving too from any where in the valley if you are seeking simple, affordable and downright deliciously satisfying food.  The menu is impressively varied, from typical, premium to signature pasties. I went with the lamb vindaloo and its spiciness left me goofy with delight.  There is no host/hostess at the entrance, so you can either seat yourself at the bar, and you can even hang your purse from underneath the counter!  The service is warm, friendly and efficient. Dinner for two without drinks was a bargain at $ 25.

bVJKHnMTXj3F8_bftoQwGQ.text: Everyone else Yelping about Cornish Pasty has already said it, so let me just echo the resounding chorus:  Pasty is the best.  The beer selection is beyond compare (plus, 3 dollar "car-bombs?"  YR KIDDING ME), and the food is amazing.  They can make vegan pasties if you call an hour ahead, so don't let dietary choices stop you from stopping in an enjoying the great service, dimly lit decor, and wonderful drinks.  Yeah, it's crowded, so if you're with a large group, you might have to wait to get the back table (it's worth it).  Certainly in the running for my favorite place in Tempe.  Top 3 pasties-  Peppered Steak the Mexican the Classic Oggie

2LFLR8W8gMWPvOiM86Z_BA.text: My husband & I ate at Squid Ink a few weeks ago, and a few times since.  The sushi is fresh and wonderful. They have a large menu.  The service is spot on.  Their prices are very reasonable.  We highly recommend it.  And plan on going back regularly.

sfRxEY1JmKeOgxLX0lBXVQ.text: Wow!  I'll keep this short since there are over 100 great reviews on on Yelp for the Cornish Pasty:  1.  I didn't know what a pasty was until today.  It was truly amazing.  2.  Red wine gravy.  I've never tasted a red wine gravy like it.  Compelling.  3.  Excellent beer and cider selection.  4.  Small place, great environment.

AGymvZSWR7aOxfIfTf-f3g.text: Just got in from CPC, and had a great time!  Our server was great, and she got us started right away with drinks. This time around, I got the cajun chicken, J. got the chicken asiago, and S. got the chicken alfredo. I was super pleased with my pasty (past-ee), the chipotle added a great kick, oh and I got a side of garlic mashed potatoes that are bomb.   *insert $3 irish car bombs*  after chatting it up a bit, J decided he wanted dessert and after asking the server which was her favorite, we got the Shirley's Favorite, which is some sort of cake baked in a cast iron pot, served with ice cream, with was muy delish.   All in all, it was a good time had at CPC.

VjB36OAT6gudu5f5MiwueA.text: I would eat here everyday if I could. I love this place. I eat the Oggie. If you get it parbaked to take home, it's cheaper. Sometimes they forget to write down oven directions, so ask!

eo-1xvwUb0D3rgIxKaZPpA.text: I just had my first Cornish Pasty experience, and can I just say yummmm!  I am a vegetarian and my boyfriend is a carnivore.  I was pleasantly surprised that I had an entire page of unique and delicious options to choose from, and I know I will be returning soon to try more.  On another note, for any of you other vegetarians out there, I sat at the bar and could see the prep area where they cut the scrumptious pasties and prep them up to go out to customers, and to my satisfaction and delight, they were thoughtful enough to use a separate knife to cut my veggie pasty.  All in all, it was a great experience.

feqGsflC_rNkTQubTfcp7Q.text: So I love this place, been coming here for years and have nothing but good things to say about it. Great food, great beers amazing, personal service and I never wanted to go anywhere else for my afternoon beers and food. Recently, however, they have formed a new policy where there is no smoking on the patio area, fully outside, ventialted patio. I do not smoke, never have never will, but that idea is ridiculous. If you want to go to a non smoking family style restaurant, and there is an applebees in every town in america period. If you want a fun, hip atmosphere with the product and staff to back it up, you come to the Cornish pasty and if smoke bothers you, you stay indoors and thats that. Dear pasty: dont give in to these high horse, internet terrorists. Your fan base loves you and will stay True. Go corporate like.everyone else, fine, someone else will be more than willing to stay local and real.

aJ5eH3d16WRrhA7oa56Erw.text: It never fails: I'm never disappointed. You can't go wrong here. Great atmosphere, good people, awesome food! If you've never had a pasty then I feel for you!  I absolutely love the Lovely Bit a Salmon, but other great ones are the Lamb Vindaloo, Chicken Tikka Masala, Rosemary Chicken, Pilgrim and the awesome Chicken Greek. Many of their pasties are available vegetarian style too.

zse9TY7o6KzsUg71Q7Ljiw.text: Big fan of this place! The food it so good and the people who work there are super nice. The Tempe location can get pretty crowded and there aren't that many tables but  still highly recommend it.

vg4b00sfDQfowBbYOhl7ig.text: Really cool place, great food, beer selection, cool friendly staff and eclectic ambiance.

5pq4v6_OyHbTy1k3omJJ1Q.text: Mmmmmm....  Oh, if you haven't been here, then you are missing out.  This place is awesome.  The pasties are delicious.  Think super gourmet hot pocket.  They also have a great beer list.  My work makes it here once a month, I go with my fiance once a month, and I will sometimes take home 1/2 baked ones for the following day.

BWUijwcNXDohEk4P1P9PFA.text: I went with a group of 5 and luckily we were able to sit in back.  The place is small and bad for groups.  Aside from that the food is awesome and the beer is cheap!    I grew up on pastys in Wisconsin, my Dad's would be called a beef stew pasty.  The variations this place has is awesome.  Good stuff!  Go!

pFoUPqhBpxzLTfKeCKnzQQ.text: Delicious!  When I first discovered this place, I came thrice in a week.  However, how good your experience is depends hugely on the pasty you order.  The original Oggie and the Vindaloo are truly fantastic; the Oggie tastes just like (better?) than the pasties I've had in England, and the Vindaloo is like my uncle's curry stuffed into delicious flaky crust.  A-mazing... and these will keep you full all day.  The service is great; even today during lunch, my friend and I never went more than fifteen minutes without being asked if we needed a refill or anything else, which was refreshing.    Highly recommended!

PyOvLsVpqnXYyV8jKry-eg.text: Was on the way to Houston from CA, and stopped by to eat here at the CPC, and damn it was really really good! I think it's a sin if you pass up this place when in Arizona.  Kinda confused cause when I walked in, but you can either sit at the bar or tables w/ the menus already on there.  Think about it this way. You'll have the best hot pocket ever. and only in Arizona!

QzI__JbTcR827EhCofcv3A.text: Oh how I miss the nights that started with a meat & cheese pasty and a pint (yes, a pint) of Ketel One & Coke.  Great food & strong drinks, what more does a guy need?

-rscTzlOZ5Iffq_z7ORcew.text: Wow!  What a great little gem this place proved to be!  After reading some of the other reviews, I decided I had to give this place a try myself.  I admit, I was skeptical, I'm not a huge 'bread' or 'carb' fan, and I really don't like thick bread coated anything.  The pasties I've had in the past were similar to calzones in breadiness.  The pasties here, were something amazing and not at all what I've had in the past or imagined.  There menu was quite complete with heavier choices such as the meat and cheese to lighter chicken options and even some dessert pasties.  I opted for a chicken tikka masala pasty.  I was impressed by the presentation, a simple metal plate with the well portioned pasty cut in half and a side of tsaziki sauce.  The pasty crust was thin and delicate.  It was reminiscent of a hand worked Christmas pie dough that your Grandmother slaved over.  It wasn't too flaky or thick, and was the perfect match for the tasty filling.  The filling was delicious chunks of white meat chicken, little nibbles of potatoes and some peas in a deliciously balanced flavorful masala sauce.  The taste was quite authentic and the spice right on par with what I'd expect from an Indian food restaurant.  The tsaziki side sauce was cool and tangy, it was a good flavor contrast to the spicy meat pocket.  Since the  portion was rather large, I had more than half of my pasty left and took it to go.  I couldn't resist trying the PB&J pasty though.  I had one warmed and packaged to go.  I am SO glad I got the PB&J pasty as well.  It was so incredibly delicious!  Served with a side of fresh whipped cream, the PB&J was like an old childhood friend.  The warm crunchy peanut butter with the perfect banana slice and sweet strawberry jelly melted harmoniously in my mouth and still gave that satisfying 'coat your mouth' feeling that peanut butter does.  I will definitely return.
